thread.title: Photos that prove wild animals are way funnier than humans
thread.title_full: Photos that prove wild animals are way funnier than humans

title: Photos that prove wild animals are way funnier than humans
text:
CNN Leadership
Photographic proof that wild animals are way funnier than humans By CNN Staff Updated 1117 GMT (1817 HKT) October 15, 2015 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists The comedian – "What does a seal get from sitting on the ice too long at the zoo? Polaroids!" This shot was taken by Julie Hunt, one of 45 finalists in the inaugural Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards. Winners will be announced in November. Click on to see more funny animal snaps. Hide Caption 1 of 30 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists Hippo does Hitchcock – "Check out my impression of Tippi Hedren in 'The Birds!'" Photo by Marc Mol. Hide Caption 2 of 30 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists What gave me away? – This poor hare, snapped by photographer Axel Kottal, just couldn't figure out why he kept losing every time they played hide and seek. Hide Caption 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists The barber – "What? He needed a trim anyways." Photo by Barrie Walsh. Hide Caption 4 of 30 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists Exxxxcellent – Though we can't be certain, this sassy pair snapped by Aaron Karnovsky appears to be planning something incredibly evil. Hide Caption 5 of 30 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists Warrior pose – Photographer Alison Buttigieg captured this adorable white sifaka in Madagascar. We can't figure out whether he's busting out his "Saturday Night Fever" moves or in the middle of a serious yoga session. Hide Caption 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists Culinary delights – "My breakfast is better than yours." Photo by Goran Anastasovski. Hide Caption 7 of 30 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists Cabin crew, prepare for landing – This quirky bird flying with his feet stuck out, snapped by photographer Charlie Davidson, reminds us of an airplane that's just released its landing gear. Hide Caption 8 of 30 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists Crowded house – "Call the realtor, honey. I think it's time to upgrade to a bigger place." Photo by Graham McGeorge. Hide Caption 9 of 30 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists Evil Knievels – "Come on. He must have left the keys around here somewhere." Photo by Simon Slater. Hide Caption 10 of 30 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists It'll be just like Grand Theft Auto – "You steer, I'll press the pedals." Photo by Christina Alexander. Hide Caption 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists Things just got awkward – "He's RIGHT behind me, isn't he." Photo by Janet Miles. Hide Caption 12 of 30 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists Step off, bro – This threatening little bird appears to be telling photographer Eric Gessmann to keep his distance. Hide Caption 13 of 30 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists Bleat this – "Why did the ram run over the cliff? He didn't see the ewe turn!" Photo by Yuzuru Masuda. Hide Caption 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists Aw, nuts! – "It seemed like a good idea at the time." Photo by John Brown. Hide Caption 15 of 30 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists Kung fu squirrel – We wouldn't want to get in the way of those fists of fury captured by photographer Julian Rad. Hide Caption 16 of 30 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists You've got good composition but .... – "I think you'll better capture the vibrancy of the colors if you increase the exposure." Photo by Julie Hunt. Hide Caption 17 of 30 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists Surprise! – "Got any snacks in there?" One of two photos by Marc Mol that made the finals. Hide Caption 18 of 30 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists Enjoy the ride – "The view's great but I'm getting quite a few flies in my teeth." Photo by Marilyn Parver. Hide Caption 19 of 30 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists Fluffy, not fat – Photographer Julian Rad snapped this shot of a furry little critter in a hurry to get somewhere. Hide Caption 20 of 30 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists Lost again – "But Google Maps told me to take a right at the oak tree." Photo by Thomas Seige. Hide Caption 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists Almost got it – See, gorillas really are just like us. Photo by Oli Dreike. Hide Caption 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists Bad hair day – Looks like somebody had a rough night. Photo by Michael Erwin. Hide Caption 23 of 30 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists They're playing my favorite jam! – Photograher Mohammed Alnaser photographed this male leopard right after a successful mating session in the Londolozi Private Game Reserve in South Africa. Hide Caption 24 of 30 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists It's not a chew toy – Unfortunately for this mom, lanolin nipple creams aren't widely available in the jungle. Photo by Renata Ewald. Hide Caption 25 of 30 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists A real head turner – Photographer Robert Ross caught up with this twisty-necked bird in Tanzania's Selous Game Reserve. Hide Caption 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists Camouflage – "If I hold still maybe they won't see me." Photo by William Richardson. Hide Caption 27 of 30 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists The bad boy – Look into those eyes. This gorilla, photographed by Gil Gofer, knows exactly what that finger means. Hide Caption 28 of 30 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists The morning after – We've all been there, little buddy. Just go back to bed. Photo by Yuzuru Masuda. Hide Caption 30 photos: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards finalists Put that thing away – "Mine's 20 inches. Now let's see yours." Photo by Stephen Biddlecombe. Hide Caption 30 of 30 (CNN) Whether it's a gorilla giving the middle finger or a hippo freaking out over a bunch of swarming birds, wild animals are more like humans than we think. And just as hilarious, too, as proven by the photos submitted to the inaugural Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards . Judges had to sift through 1,502 entries from 52 different countries to come up with the 45 recently announced finalists. "I cant believe the incredible amount of entries we have achieved in our first year and from so many different countries, its very exciting indeed," says Paul Joynson-Hicks, the founder and a wildlife photographer himself. "Judging was incredibly hard as we had a lot of hilarious images to try and whittle down to the final 45. I think people have really enjoyed this competition, something a little bit different. It definitely exceeds our expectations for our inaugural year." Read More According to the rules, all of the photos had to have been taken in the wild. That means no domestic animals and no animals that live in zoos or other captive environments. The next stage of judging will happen later this month, say organizers, with the winners due to be announced on November 11. Prizes include photographic safaris in southern Tanzania and Nikon cameras. Check out the above gallery for a few of our favorite finalists. Food Network
